qlearning.client

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • qlearning.client.State

  • public abstract class State
extends Object
    A condition that you want to reward or discourage the system from arriving at, and all of the gridworld.actions that it is possible to take while in this condition.

    The desirability of this condition is determined by the reward provided by getReward(). Higher values will make the system prefer this state. Possible gridworld.actions are provided by getActions().

    Note: This class must implement hashCode() and equals(Object)! The system uses these comparisons to look up the quality values of State-Action pairs, so if two different States are seen as equivalent, then the system will not work correctly.

    • Method Detail

      • getReward

        public abstract Reward getReward()
        Get the desirability of the current state. Higher values will make the Agent prefer this state, and lower values will make it avoid this state. It is best to choose rewards based on the desirability of the outcome, not of behaviors, to allow the system the most freedom to search. It robs the algorithm of its power to reward for behavior and not outcome.
        Returns:
        the score of this state's desirability

      • getActions

        public abstract Set<Action> getActions()
        Get all Actions that is possible to perform while in this state
        Returns:
        all gridworld.actions that can be taken
